distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for rh-nodejs12-nodejs is now available for Red Hat Software Collections.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Node.js is a software development platform for building fast and scalable network applications in the JavaScript programming language. 

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: rh-nodejs12-nodejs (12.18.2).

Security Fix(es):

* ICU: Integer overflow in UnicodeString::doAppend() (CVE-2020-10531)

* nghttp2: overly large SETTINGS frames can lead to DoS (CVE-2020-11080)

* nodejs-minimist: prototype pollution allows adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a constructor or __proto__ payload (CVE-2020-7598)

* nodejs: TLS session reuse can lead to hostname verification bypass (CVE-2020-8172)

* nodejs: memory corruption in napi_get_value_string_* functions (CVE-2020-8174)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

notes.text: A flaw was found in nodejs-minimist, where it was tricked into adding or modifying properties of the Object.prototype using a "constructor" or "__proto__" payload. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-7598 nodejs-minimist: prototype pollution allows adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a constructor or __proto__ payload
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Quay only includes minimist as a dependency of the test suites, and it not include it in the product. We may fix this issue in a future Red Hat Quay release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-7598 nodejs-minimist: prototype pollution allows adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using a constructor or __proto__ payload

notes.text: A TLS Hostname verification bypass vulnerability exists in NodeJS. This flaw allows an attacker to bypass TLS Hostname verification when a TLS client reuses HTTPS sessions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-8172 nodejs: TLS session reuse can lead to hostname verification bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue only affects the TLS 1.2 protocol, not TLS 1.3. This issue does not affect NodeJS 10.

Red Hat Quay installed NodeJS as a dependency of Yarn. It does not use NodeJS at runtime, but executes Javascript on the client's browser instead. Therefore the impact of this vulnerability on Red Hat Quay is low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-8172 nodejs: TLS session reuse can lead to hostname verification bypass

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A flaw was found in nodejs.  Calling napi_get_value_string_latin1(), napi_get_value_string_utf8(), or napi_get_value_string_utf16() with a non-NULL buf, and a bufsize of 0 will cause the entire string value to be written to buf, probably overrunning the length of the buffer.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-8174 nodejs: memory corruption in napi_get_value_string_* functions
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: NodeJS is a build time dependency of Red Hat Quay and is not used at runtime. Therefore this issue will not fixed in Quay 3.3.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-8174 nodejs: memory corruption in napi_get_value_string_* functions

notes.text: An issue was discovered in International Components for Unicode (ICU) for C/C++ through 66.1. An integer overflow, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow, exists in the UnicodeString::doAppend() function in common/unistr.cpp.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2020-10531 ICU: Integer overflow in UnicodeString::doAppend()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-10531 ICU: Integer overflow in UnicodeString::doAppend()

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A resource consumption vulnerability was found in nghttp2. This flaw allows an attacker to repeatedly construct an overly large HTTP/2 SETTINGS frame with a length of 14,400 bytes that causes excessive CPU usage, leading to a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: overly large SETTINGS frames can lead to DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: overly large SETTINGS frames can lead to DoS
